word: IT WILL BE OBSERVED THAT TOGETHER WITH HIS REPORT OF PROGRESS, ELDER WHITE MADE MENTION OF THE LACK OF "PEACE AND HARMONY THAT SOMETIMES HAS BEEN MANIFEST" IN OUR GENERAL CONFERENCE SESSIONS. IN THIS HE WAS REFERRING TO THE THEOLOGICAL DISCUSSIONS THAT MADE THE 1888 MEETING DIFFERENT FROM ANY OTHER GENERAL CONFERENCE IN ADVENTIST HISTORY.
